label: 知行国
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: An entire province held in proprietorship by a ranking court noble or religious institution during the late Heian and Kamakura periods. The province proprietor (kokushu) could appoint governors (kokushi) and other officials to the province and received income from the cultivated public lands" (kokugaryō) in the province.↓[国守、国司、国衙領]　"
